channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Attacks on ICE Must Stop
item.description: The latest attack on an agency facility in Dallas is not an isolated incident.

item.title: Vance Slams Democrats, Media For ‘Encouraging Crazy People’ To ‘Commit Violence’

item.title: Why Imposing Consequences For Evil Acts Isn’t Cancel Culture
item.description: This is very obvious to people who can think their way out of a wet paper bag Sharpied over with 'cancel culture bad.'

item.title: Stablecoins are everywhere, but one expert argues that the ultimate winner might not even exist yet

item.title: Obama says he has been 'digging myself out of' hole with Michelle
item.description: President Barack Obama admits he has been digging himself out of a hole in his relationship with Michelle Obama during his European speaking tour.

item.title: Apple is delaying its live translation for Europeans because of their pesky red tape
item.description: Apple was already fined after the Digital Markets Act took effect last year.

item.title: The American Left Is Resurrecting The Bloody Legacy Of John Brown
item.description: We should take the left’s invocation of John Brown seriously. It’s a call to murder anyone who opposes their agenda.

item.title: Meet Lindsey Halligan, the 36-year-old former Miss Colorado hopeful who only worked 3 federal cases before Trump promoted her to U.S. attorney
item.description: Halligan, who competed in the Miss Colorado USA pageant twice, will now lead one of the nation's most important federal prosecutor offices.

item.title: Exclusive: Docs Show How Dearborn’s Muslim Leaders Make It A ‘Hostile Place For Christians And Jews’
item.description: After Dearborn Michigan's mayor told a Christian minister he is 'not welcome,' docs obtained by The Federalist suggest unequal treatment.

item.title: There’s Too Much of Everything
item.description: The deluge of entertainment and information in our era is diluting our enjoyment.

item.title: Visiting a New University in Austin, Texas
item.description: Places like the University of Austin, driven by the Great Books, merit, and free inquiry, are part of the mix in changing higher ed’s tune.

item.title: Media, Dems Won’t Apologize For Comparing ICE To Gestapo After Attack Targeting Agents
item.description: Democrats declined to apologize for comparing ICE to the Gestapo in the wake of a deadly attack on an ICE facility in Texas.

item.title: Gen Zers are dating people 25% better than they are. They’re calling it ‘throning’—and experts say it’s a quick ticket to long-term success
item.description: Dating experts say “throning” works—it just depends on how your treat your ex and your newfound network.

item.title: White House tells agencies to draft mass firing plans ahead of potential shutdown
item.description: The White House is telling agencies to prepare large-scale firings of federal workers if the government shuts down next week.

item.title: Justice Department trying to indict former FBI Director Comey by next week
item.description: Federal prosecutors are trying to indict former FBI Director James B. Comey before the statute of limitations runs out next week for perjury charges.
